greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n mod phi(n).
comment: By Lehmer's Conjecture, when n > 2 then a(n) = 1 if and only if n is prime. The Notices article states "Lehmer's Conjecture (1932). phi(n) | (n-1) if and only if n is prime." - _Michael Somos_, Oct 14 2011
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
D. H. Bailey and J. M. Borwein, Exploratory Experimentation and Computation, Notices of A. M. S. 58 (2011) 1410-1419, see p. 1416.
formula: b^(n - a(n)) == 1 (mod n) for every b coprime to n. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jun 30 2017
program: a068494 n = mod n $ a000010 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2011
(MAGMA) [n mod EulerPhi(n): n in [1..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 19 2015
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Mar 11 2002
